These are ModuleManager patches, they just need to be in a .cfg file anywhere in the GameData folder. It is advisable to keep your own patches separate from mods (i.e. not in the TweakScale folder), so you do not accidentally lose them when removing or updating mod folders.

KSPApiExtensions was stockified in 1.2, so if you have it some of your mods are badly out of date. If either TweakScale refuses to load properly or the scaling modules are not applied by <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>, the nyour log will probably tell why. I can have a look if you upload it somewhere (first thing I would do is search for 'exception').
